org.bamja.core.impl
Class BundleManager

java.lang.Object
  org.bamja.core.impl.BundleManager

public final class BundleManager
extends java.lang.Object

It will manage the bundle with all its components. It will read the configuration from the annotaions or from metadata.xml file (this jobs delegate the BundleManager to special Klasses) and will create the corresponding ComponentManager for each component.

Since:
Version: 0.1.0 (16.02.2006)
Author:
Humberto Cervantes, Jens Kutzsche

Method Detail

startManage

public void startManage(BundleContext context,
                        GenericActivator activator)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Starting the management of the bundle. This method arranges reading the configuration and invokes initialize().

Parameters:
context - The context of the bundle which manages from this BundleManager.
activator - The activator of the bundle which manages from this BundleManager.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Any exception thrown during starting the management of the bundle.

startComponent

public boolean startComponent(java.lang.Class componentClass)

stopManage

public void stopManage()
Stopping the management of the bundle. This method arranges destroying all the component managers.

getBundleContext

public BundleContext getBundleContext()
Returns:
The context of the bundle which manages from this BundleManager.

getActivator

public GenericActivator getActivator()
